Package idlreasonerchoco.analyzer

Class Analyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • idlreasonerchoco.analyzer.Analyzer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OASAnalyzer
    public abstract class Analyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Analyzer is an abstract class that provides analysis operations for IDL and API requests. This class provides the following operations:
    • isConsistent()
    • isDeadParameter(String)
    • isFalseOptional(String)
    • isValidIDL()
    • isValidRequest(Map)
    • isValidPartialRequest(Map)
    Also, it can be used to getRandomValidRequest(), getRandomInvalidRequest(), and updateData(Map).

      IDL configuration object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Analyzer

        protected Analyzer​(java.lang.String specificationType,
                   java.lang.String apiSpecification,
                   java.lang.String operationPath,
                   java.lang.String operationType)
            throws IDLException
        This constructor pass the received parameters to Analyzer(String, String, String, String, boolean) to initialize IDLConfiguration instance.
        Parameters:
        specificationType - specification type.
        apiSpecification - API specification.
        operationPath - operation path.
        operationType - operation type.
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.
        See Also:
        IDLConfiguration

                   java.lang.String apiSpecification,
                   java.lang.String operationPath,
                   java.lang.String operationType,
                   boolean specAsString)
            throws IDLException
        This constructor uses the received parameters to initialize IDLConfiguration instance.
        Parameters:
        specificationType - specification type.
        apiSpecification - API specification.
        operationPath - operation path.
        operationType - operation type.
        specAsString - true or false.
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.
        See Also:
        IDLConfiguration

    • Method Detail

      • isConsistent

        public abstract boolean isConsistent()
                              throws IDLException
        Returns true if the IDL is consistent. An IDL is consistent if there exists at least one request satisfying all the dependencies of the specification.
        Returns:
        true if the IDL is consistent, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.

      • isDeadParameter

        public abstract boolean isDeadParameter​(java.lang.String paramName)
                                 throws IDLException
        Returns true if the parameter is dead. A parameter is dead if it cannot be included in any valid call to the service.
        Parameters:
        paramName - parameter name.
        Returns:
        true if the parameter is dead, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.

      • isFalseOptional

        public abstract boolean isFalseOptional​(java.lang.String paramName)
                                 throws IDLException
        Returns true if the parameter is a false optional. A parameter is false optional if it is required despite being defined as optional.
        Parameters:
        paramName - parameter name.
        Returns:
        true if the parameter is false optional, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.

      • isValidIDL

        public abstract java.lang.Boolean isValidIDL()
                                      throws IDLException
        Returns true if the IDL is valid. An IDL specification is valid if it is consistent and it does not contain any dead or false optional parameters.
        Returns:
        true if the IDL is valid, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.
        See Also:
        OASConsistent, OASDeadParameter, OASFalseOptional

      • getRandomValidRequest

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getRandomValidRequest()
                                                                                      throws IDLException
        Returns a map of random valid request. This map contains parameter name as a key and parameter's value as a value.
        Returns:
        valid request.
        • key : parameter name
        • value : parameter value
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.

      • getRandomInvalidRequest

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getRandomInvalidRequest()
                                                                                        throws IDLException
        Returns a map of random invalid request. This map contains parameter name as a key and parameter's value as a value.
        Returns:
        invalid request.
        • key : parameter name
        • value : parameter value
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.

      • isValidRequest

        public abstract boolean isValidRequest​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> request)
                                throws IDLException
        Returns true if the request is valid. A request is valid if it satisfies all the dependencies of the IDL specification.
        Parameters:
        request - to be checked if it is valid or not.
        Returns:
        true if the request is valid, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.

      • isValidPartialRequest

        public abstract boolean isValidPartialRequest​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> request)
                                       throws IDLException
        Returns true if the request is partially valid. A request is partially valid means that some other parameters should still be included to make it a full valid request.
        Parameters:
        request - to be checked if it is partially valid or not.
        Returns:
        true if the request is partially valid, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.

      • updateData

        public abstract void updateData​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.lang.String>> data)
                         throws IDLException
        Updates parameters data as a map. This map contains parameter name as key and list of parameter values as value.
        • key : parameter name
        • value : list of values
        Parameters:
        data - to be updated
        Throws:
        IDLException - IDL exception.
